ethics 2:
Summarize the ethics textbook content in a simple HTML format. Follow these guidelines:

1. Use this basic HTML structure:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>[Insert chapter or topic title]</title>
    <style>
        body {
            font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
            line-height: 1.6;
            color: #333;
            max-width: 800px;
            margin: 0 auto;
            padding: 20px;
        }
        h1, h2, h3 {
            color: #2c3e50;
        }
    </style>
</head>
<body>
[Insert content here]
</body>
</html>

2. Replace [Topic] with the specific chapter or section title from the textbook.

3. Break down the content under the main <h1> using <h2> tags for major subtopics.

4. Use <h3> tags for further subtopics if necessary.

5. Present key points as bullet points using <ul> and <li> tags.

6. Include only information from the textbook. Do not add external examples or explanations.

7. Focus on the most important concepts, definitions, theories, and arguments.

8. Keep explanations brief and to the point.

9. Cover all significant terms and ideas mentioned in the book, even if only briefly.

10. Maintain the original order of topics as presented in the textbook.

11. If certain points are emphasized in the book, make sure to include them.

12. Use <strong> tags to highlight key terms or especially important points.

13. If referencing specific pages or sections, include these in parentheses, e.g., (p. 45) or (Section 3.2).

Create a complete HTML document that summarizes the major textbook topics concisely, suitable for quick review before an exam. Each summary should be a self-contained HTML document focusing on a specific topic or chapter.

IMPORTANT: JUST WRITE THE HTML CODE, NOTHING ELSE LIKE AN INTRODUCTION OR OTHER TEXT. JUST THE HTML
